Dear Ms. ONeill:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, Area Manager, at (616) 204-6992.

ALLEGATION:
Agency did not complete the 3130A in required time frame, leading to the ability for
unrelated foster placement having the option to appeal to Foster Care Review
Board.
INVESTIGATION:
On June 30, 2021 a special investigation was initiated regarding the allegations
described above. Staff were interviewed and documents were reviewed. What
follows is information gathered from the various documents.
On July 1, 2021 I interviewed Director and Supervisor face to face, separately at the
agency. Supervisor reported a further assessment was warranted for the family as
the Initial Relative Safety Screen was denied. Director and Supervisor reported the
shut down due to Covid 19 delayed the Central Registry clearance and the Child
Protective Services histories that were needed to further assess the family.
2

A timeline of Youth A entering foster care and the completion of the reports is listed
below.
 Youth A enters foster care on 01/31/2020 and is placed in an
unrelated/licensed foster home.
 Relative Notification Letter, DHS-990, was provided to Relative 1 on
02/06/2020 and the agency received the relative response on 2/10/20 where
the relative reported they wanted to be considered for placement of the youth.
 Relative Placement Safety Screen, MDHHS-5770, dated 03/04/2020 denied
Relative 1 due to relative being on central registry.
 Documentation for Child Abuse/Neglect – Central Registry Expunction Action,
DHS-1200, dated 04/14/2020, verifying relative Central Registry expunction.
 Documentation for Child Protective Services history on relatives received by
agency on 05/27/2020.
 Initial Relative Placement Home Study, DHS-3130-A, completed 07/01/2020
– approved caregiver for placement.
 Addendum to Relative Placement Home Study, DHS-3130-A, completed on
08/06/2020 – approved caregiver for placement.
APPLICABLE RULE
FOM 722-03B Relative Engagement and Placement
If CPS denies placement with a relative caregiver and the
child is placed in an unrelated/licensed foster home, then
the foster care caseworker must review the denied MDHHS-
5770 with their supervisor to determine if placement would
be appropriate upon further assessment via the DHS-
3130A. The result of this review must be documented in the
initial case service plan.
If further assessment is warranted, the DHS-3130A must be
completed within 45 calendar days of removal. If the
placement recommendation on the DHS-3130A is approved,
the child must be placed with the relative.
ANALYSIS: The agency failed to complete the Relative Placement Home
Study, DHS-3130-A, within 45 days.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
